title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes the Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under Subpart XI of the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will establish the Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program for health professionals to receive student loan repayments in exchange for serving in a frontline care scarcity area for at least 2 years. Eligibility requires submitting an application and signing a contract. Participants are approved upon meeting program requirements. The Secretary will give preference to applicants with interdisciplinary training in awarding contracts for the Loan Repayment Program. Recipients will be placed in frontline care scarcity areas, with a focus on areas with established programs. The Secretary will determine frontline care scarcity areas for contract recipients in interdisciplinary programs. Written notice of approval will be provided promptly, and a written contract will outline the terms of student loan repayment. The contract described in this subsection is a written agreement between the Secretary and an individual for student loan repayment in exchange for providing frontline care services for a minimum of 2 years at a healthcare facility in a scarcity area. The contract for student loan repayment involves providing frontline care services for at least 2 years in a healthcare facility in a scarcity area. The agreement includes conditions on funds availability, damages for breach of contract, and other relevant statements determined by the Secretary. The amount of annual loan repayment is decided by the Secretary to attract healthcare providers to participate. The Secretary determines the amount of annual student loan repayment to attract healthcare providers. The Secretary may directly pay the loan provider on behalf of the individual. If the individual breaches the contract by not fulfilling their service obligation, the United States can recover the total amount paid under the contract plus interest. The United States can recover the total amount paid to an individual under a contract if they fail to fulfill their service obligation in a frontline care scarcity area. Frontline care services include health care services in various fields provided by professionals who have completed an accredited program in the United States. Frontline care services encompass a range of healthcare professions like registered dieticians, occupational therapists, pediatricians, respiratory therapists, medical technologists, otolaryngologists, and radiologic technologists who have completed accredited programs in the US. Appropriations for fiscal years 2010-2015 are specified, with subsequent years adjusted for the average percentage increase in health professions education costs. The Secretary is tasked with implementing these provisions. For fiscal year 2016 onwards, appropriations will be adjusted based on the average increase in health professions education costs. The Secretary must start the loan repayment program within 180 days of this section's enactment.
